meanings.definition: The state or quality of being fast or quick.
meanings.sent1: Her fastness in running races always impressed her friends.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah's fastness allowed it to catch its prey easily.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race to test its fastness.
meanings.sent4: His fastness in decision-making made him a reliable leader.
meanings.sent5: The fastness of the river's current was too strong to swim against.

meanings.sent1: The castle served as a fastness for the royal family during wars.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers sought refuge in the mountain fastness during the battle.
meanings.sent3: The fastness of the fortress kept the enemies at bay.
meanings.sent4: The fastness of the bank vault ensured the safety of the valuables.
meanings.sent5: The fastness of the bunker provided protection during the storm.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: The fastness of the material made it suitable for heavy-duty use.
meanings.sent2: The bridge's fastness ensured it could bear the weight of passing trucks.
meanings.sent3: The fastness of the helmet protected the rider during the fall.
meanings.sent4: The fastness of the rope prevented it from snapping under tension.
meanings.sent5: The fastness of the wall withstood the impact of the strong winds.

meanings.definition: The quality of being firmly fixed in place.
meanings.sent1: The fastness of the tree roots kept the soil stable on the slope.
meanings.sent2: The fastness of the anchor prevented the boat from drifting away.
meanings.sent3: The fastness of the glue ensured the pieces stayed together.
meanings.sent4: The fastness of the building's foundation made it earthquake-resistant.
meanings.sent5: The fastness of the lock kept the door securely closed.
